description: From Ancient Greek τάξις (táxis, “arrangement", "order”) + δέρμα (dérma, “skin”). Analysable as taxi- +‎ derm- +‎ -y.

entries.meaning: The art of stuffing and mounting the skins of dead animals for exhibition in a lifelike state.

verbs.description: taxidermy (third-person singular simple present taxidermies, present participle taxidermying, simple past and past participle taxidermied)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To stuff and mount the skin of a dead animal.
examples: Today's taxidermying is a combination of field work, calipers and Rodin. The hunters who get the animals for the leading museums of natural science bring 'em back dead, but measured within an inch of their lives  […]
